summary:
Requests that the Committee be prepared to list individuals, groups, undertakings, and entities in Libya associated with Al-Qaida or ISIL.

Urges Member States to swiftly assist the Government of National Accord in responding to threats to Libyan security.
13. Calls on the Government of National Accord to promote and protect human rights of all individuals, including women, children, and vulnerable groups, and comply with international law obligations.

14. Calls on the Government of National Accord to hold accountable those responsible for violations of international humanitarian law and human rights abuses, including those involving sexual violence, and cooperate with the International Criminal Court.

15. Urges Member States to cooperate with the Government of National Accord and share information on migrant smuggling and human trafficking in Libya's territorial sea and high seas.

16. Requests the Secretary-General to maintain flexibility in UNSMIL staffing and operations to support Libya's implementation of agreements and confidence-building measures.

17. Affirms readiness to review the Measures and UNSMIL's mandate in light of developments in Libya.

18. Calls on all parties to cooperate with UNSMIL's activities, ensuring security and unhindered movement for UN personnel.

19. Requests the Secretary-General to report on implementation of the Libyan Political Agreement.

20. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
